page.title: 11MRS MELLORS OF DEFYNNOG
page.content: I got up at half past nine and went to put the kettle on. Then I went back upstairs, got dressed, and made the beds then we all went down to the village. I bought a packet of rolos for the children, and a packet of cigarettes. We went back home and I hoovered upstairs and tidied up.Then I made dinner which was sausage, beans and potatoes.After that I made welsh cakes and addressed some envelopes for the Labour Party at the same time. Then I made tea. When we had eaten it I knitted and watched television for a while. Then the visitors arrived and they carried on addressing envelopes so I made them a cup of tea. When they had finished doing that I made them some supper and we talk for a while. At half past two they went home and I went to bed. (29/6/85 M.E.Mellors. Transcribed by Sarah Mellors)
